text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly addresses the core requirement of the criterion. It states that the English court can grant a freezing injunction 'only in limited circumstances' and clarifies that the injunction's function must be 'to preserve assets to preserve the enforceability of a future arbitral award' (Section 2(B) and the Conclusion). It grounds this in s.44 AA 1996 as ancillary jurisdiction 'in support of arbitration' and emphasizes that the court will avoid undermining the arbitration.", "criterion_id": "d39c2db7-4452-45f6-a351-13a7da2c4632"}
